title: Computer-Supported Collaborative Mathematics Learning Design in Multicultural Environments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts, proficiency in basic digital tools
context.additional_context: Collaborative Learning Environment for Office/Administrative Professionals with Multicultural Backgrounds. Hybrid Classes Using Personal Devices (BYOD)

learning_goals: Learners can utilize effective communication strategies while collaborating with multicultural team members to solve mathematical problems
Learners can select and perform roles (e.g., coordinator, analyst, executor) aligned with their thinking styles in a CSCL environment

Over 2–4 weeks, learners can solve three or more given mathematics problems in a project-based assessment, write a 3–5-page report reflecting cultural contexts (e.g., traditional pattern analysis, multicultural statistical data), and present findings in 5 minutes.

resources: Online Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Padlet, etc.)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
